name: The Retreat Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancée & I had a great 3 night stay at The Retreat recently. We booked the Emanuel suite and found everything as described; the room was very well appointed, spotlessly clean and well maintained. The location is convenient for the seafront and for old Portsmouth (15 - 20 minutes walk away) and it’s also quiet, so you’re guaranteed a good night’s sleep. Breakfast was excellent with quality ingredients and splendid presentation. Mark & Sian were perfect hosts with plenty of restaurant and pub suggestions – ‘Rosie’s Wine Bar’; ‘The hole in the wall’ and ‘The King Street Tavern’ are great places if you’re after some good food and real ale. I highly recommend The Retreat.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

likes.liked: — High quality of accomodation & service from proprietors

reviews.text: Just like to say we enjoyed our stay at the Reteat as well. We stayed in the Franklin Suite and it was everything it said on the web site with a little bit more. Good decor and very well presented and tasty breakfast. The hosts are just what you need when you are new to an area , welcoming and have ideas of where to go for a night out.. Thanks and I hope we can stay again sometime.
reviews.title: A real treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can we say that hasn't already been put in !!? Came upon the Retreat Guest House whilst looking on t' internet for a place to stay for an overnight stop in Pompey. COULDN'T HAVE MADE A BETTER CHOICE!! The proprieters Mark & Sian were warm, welcoming hosts.The room ( Ward suite ) was impressively furnished , and a good nights sleep was had on a very comfy bed. The breakfast in the morning was served with a smile,and was lovely. We have taken quite a few business cards from the Retreat, to pass on to our friends..... what a pity ,because as they say ... If you get a good ' thing', keep it to yourself !!
reviews.title: Sad to be home!

likes.liked: — Everything, Mark and Sian really welcome you into their beautiful house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Originally we booked two nights at the Retreat guesthouse, in the Ward Suite, however on the drive up to Portsmouth we had a car crash, wrote off the car and had to spend a couple of hours at the hospital. Sian and Mark were wonderful, helping us to find a way of getting to the Salvage yard, and Mark's sense of humour gave us a smile. Having had our first night/day ruined by our car accident we asked to stay an extra night and they did have a room free, the Franklin room. The whole house was decorated to a brilliant standard, each room had its own charm and both the rooms we stayed in were impeccably clean. The English breakfast was amazing, I’ve never seen such wonderful presentation, and it kept us filled till dinner time which was a huge bonus! The choice of cereals was really nice as well. Location was great it was a short walk to Southsea shops and we enjoyed lovely walks along the seafront to get to Portsmouth town centre and Gunwarf Quay. Fell in love with the area and especially the house, it’s just sad to come home!
reviews.title: Loved this place!

description: A Grade II listed building in the heart of Southsea’s conservation area, this Victorian house has been extensively modernised and now offers contemporary comforts whilst retaining its original character.Carefully restored and sensitively refurbished, this beautiful original Victorian building now houses 4 spacious en suite rooms, each of which is individually designed in a unique boutique style. Every stylish and attractive room features great modern comforts and facilities, including LCD flat-screen TVs, tea/coffee making facilities and complimentary toiletries. A generous full cooked English breakfast is included in the price and is complemented by fresh cafetière coffee and speciality teas.The Retreat Guest House offers the best of all worlds: beautiful period character and charm, alongside contemporary comforts and amenities. The guest house also has a superb location, tucked away in a quiet street in the heart of Southsea, close to all that the area has to offer.
